Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Functional components data merging util" (#6895) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Hi! Components have the extend feature, but there is nothing similar for functional components. The problem and the solution is well explained at https://github.com/alexsasharegan/vue-functional-data-merge and while that works fine and I am very grateful to the author, I would like to request an official in core solution.

Why? Because there are edge situations or new features that 3rd party solution will have a difficult time to be on top.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Similar as done by @alexsasharegan

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Call scrollBehavior with app context" (#1804) at vuejs/vue-router

Events.RelatedBody:
Browser default to perform a scroll when popstate happens which cause a glitch especially when using vue-router async scroll.

`
window.history.scrollRestoration = 'manual';
`

Fix by adding this line.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Prevent browser scroll behavior on History popstate" (#1814) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
Browser default to perform a scroll when popstate happens which cause a glitch especially when using vue-router async scroll.

`
window.history.scrollRestoration = 'manual';
`

Fix by adding this line.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "fix(resolveAsyncComponents): return object when module is empty" (#1818) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
When `resolvedDef.default` is `undefined`, `match.components[key]` will be `undefined` instead of a object like `{_Ctor: {},  inject: {}}` in v2.7.
I thought this behavior may break compatibility with previous versions, pls feel free to review and discuss.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Doc EN]: Official Vue way to speak about a version and greater version." (#1841) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi @posva, we have seen with @chrisvfritz a way to harmonize speaking about a version and greater version has following:

`product version` => only this version
`product version+` => this version and greater (this one replace the `product >= version` way)
